title: Watch Joni Mitchell perform 'Summertime' at Gershwin Prize concert
description: James Taylor, Brandi Carlile, Annie Lennox and Angélique Kidjo are among the artists performing on Joni Mitchell: The Library of Congress Gershwin Prize for Popular Song, airing on PBS this evening.

title: Trump's online supporters remain muted after his indictment
description: Donald Trump's supporters on far-right social media platforms appear less enthusiastic about coming to the former president's aid. They're wary of ending in the same place of Jan. 6 rioters.

title: ChatGPT is temporarily banned in Italy amid an investigation into data collection
description: Italian authorities are temporarily banning ChatGPT while it investigates the company behind the AI tool. Italy is considered the first government to take such a measure against ChatGPT.

title: A tornado slams Little Rock, smashing rooftops and flipping vehicles
description: A tornado plowed through Little Rock and surrounding areas on Friday afternoon, reducing rooftops to splinters, toppling vehicles and tossing debris on roadways as people raced for shelter.

title: What happens after Trump's indictment? Here are some of the logistical considerations
description: The historic indictment of former President Donald Trump raises all sorts of legal, political and logistical questions. While it's early days, experts expect an arraignment soon and a delayed trial.

title: 'In Dusty we trusty': Can the Owls complete the March Madness Cinderella story?
description: The Florida Atlantic Owls are an underdog team with zero NCAA Tournament wins before 2023. Head coach Dusty May has pulled off an unbelievable run to get them within an inch of history.

title: The Justice Department adds to suits against Norfolk Southern over the Ohio derailment
description: The federal government is accusing Norfolk Southern of  "unlawfully polluting" the country's waterways and violating the Clean Water Act in the accident near East Palestine.

title: At a Nashville hospital, the agony of not being able to help school shooting victims
description: A pediatric surgeon and his colleagues at Vanderbilt University Medical Center had prepared for a mass casualty event, but the victims of Monday's shooting had already died by the time they arrived.

title: Men's Final Four rewrites history as two teams try to move on to NCAA title game
description: As the highest-ranked team left standing, it's up to No. 4 seed UConn to restore order in a tournament that's been marked by wild upsets. But it's not the only team with a strong resume.

title: Social Security is now expected to run short of cash by 2033
description: Policymakers will need to patch the Social Security program by 2033 to avoid draconian cuts in benefits, a year earlier than had been predicted. A trust fund for Medicare will run out of cash by 2031.

title: Oscar Pistorius, South African Olympian, is denied parole in his girlfriend's murder
description: Pistorius was sentenced to 13 years and five months in prison for in 2017, four years after he shot and killed Reeva Steenkamp in their home, claiming he mistook her for an intruder.

title: Virginia Norwood, a pioneer in satellite land imaging, dies at age 96
description: Norwood is best known for developing the Multispectral Scanner System that flew on the first Landsat satellite. That was the first satellite launched to study and monitor Earth's landmasses.

title: Arrest orders are issued for 6 people in the deadly Mexican immigration center fire
description: Three officials from Mexico's immigration agency, two private security guards and the migrant accused of starting the fire, which killed at least 39, face charges of homicide and causing injury.

title: U.S. Capitol rioter the 'QAnon Shaman' is released early from federal prison
description: Jacob Chansley recieved one of the longest sentences handed down to a U.S. Capitol rioter. He has been freed from prison and sent to a reentry center until late May.

title: These cockroaches tweaked their mating rituals after adapting to pest control
description: The German cockroach evolved to live only in human environments. This roach is very good at adapting to pest control methods — even if it means changing its mating rituals.

title: Pope Francis will be discharged from the hospital on Saturday
description: The pope will leave the hospital on Saturday, three days after he was hospitalized for respiratory problems. He was diagnosed with bronchitis. Francis will be present for Palm Sunday ceremonies.

title: Why Trump isn't the first president to face arrest
description: The nature of Trump's indictment is unprecedented, but the first time a president faced arrest was over 100 years ago.

title: How the $7,500 tax credit to buy an electric car is about to change yet again
description: Tax credits for electric car purchases are getting even more complicated. It will likely mean fewer vehicles will qualify — but we don't know which.

title: 5 key takeaways from the Trump indictment news
description: Former president Donald Trump has been indicted by a New York grand jury. District Attorney Alvin Bragg's office said it has contacted Trump's attorney "to coordinate his surrender" for arraignment.

title: Irvo Otieno's mom wants justice for him and a better system for everyone else
description: Ten people have been charged with murder in Otieno's death at a Virginia psychiatric hospital earlier this month. Caroline Ouko and attorney Ben Crump reflect on his life and what happens next.

title: Mother of a Black man, who died after being pinned down at a hospital, speaks out
description: Irvo Otieno died at a Virginia psychiatric hospital earlier this month. Ten people have been indicted in his death. NPR's A Martinez talks to his mother Caroline Ouko and attorney Ben Crump.

title: Google's 'Ghost Workers' are demanding to be seen by the tech giant
description: Google has a massive workforce of subcontractors to help maintain its search engine and now they're asking for more labor rights.

title: When homelessness and mental illness overlap, is compulsory treatment compassionate?
description: Democratic leaders in California and Oregon are becoming more open to using involuntary psychiatric commitment to combat homelessness, drug abuse and untreated mental illness.

title: After 50 years, a Florida aquarium plans to return Lolita the orca to her home waters
description: The 57-year-old orca was captured over 50 years ago at the age of 4 from the Pacific coast near Seattle. She retired last spring from performing in exhibition shows.

title: The future terrified Nancy until a doctor gave her life-changing advice
description: Nancy and her husband, Tom, were terrified after Tom had fainting incidents and doctors couldn't give them answers. That was until one doctor gave them some advice that continues to help them today.

title: Trump uses indictment to unify GOP, even as his vulnerabilities are glaring
description: After the indictment news broke, the Trump GOP machine rolled out a political playbook meant to insulate him with his base. It may work, but his brand is toxic with much of the rest of Americans.

title: 5 mysteries and thrillers to transport you this spring
description: As the weather improves around many parts of the U.S, grab some green space and sit down to let these books transport you to 1950s London, 1920s Manhattan, 21st-century Finland, and more.

title: Report questions the Mounties in a probe examining the Nova Scotia mass shootings
description: A public inquiry recommends that the government rethink the Royal Canadian Mounted Police's central role in the country's policing.

title: Authorities are investigating 33 swimmers for allegedly harassing dolphins in Hawaii
description: The Marine Mammal Protection Act was amended in 2021 to prohibit people from being within 50 feet of spinner dolphins in Hawaii.

title: A patch marks the spot — for players debuting in Major League Baseball
description: Major League Baseball announced that players making their first appearances will wear debut patches on their jerseys. The patch will appear on different places of a sleeve.

title: Gwyneth Paltrow wins her ski crash case — and $1 in damages
description: The Utah jury quickly sided with the Oscar-winning actress -turned-lifestyle guru on Thursday, saying that she wasn't at fault and that she was the victim in the 2016 ski slope collision.

title: Trump's historic indictment comes during his presidential primary run
description: Donald Trump will become the first former president to face criminal charges — and it's happening right in the middle of a presidential primary campaign.
